From: laurakreiman2@gmail.com
To:
  - Lidia
  - Gabriel kreiman
Time: 2025-10-01T09:54:07-03:00
Subject: Fwd: Cotizacion casa grande Cariló
Por el momento reservan de a 1 semana acá en casa grande .
Y me dicen q los departamentos son maximo 5 personas cada depto de los grandes
Lau
Inicio del mensaje reenviado:
> **De:** info@casagrandecarilo.com.ar
> **Fecha:** 1 de octubre de 2025, 09:45:52 ART
> **Para:** laurakreiman2@gmail.com
> **Asunto:** **Cotizacion**
>
>
> 
>  Estimada Laura, buen día. Líneas abajo le pasamos la cotización solicitada.
> Hasta agotar unidades promocionadas.
> Desde ya muchas gracias y ante cualquier inquietud nos encontramos a disposición.
> Aprovecho para comentarle que estos valores están sujetos a modificación y no incluyen I.V.A.
> En caso de reservar el plazo de pago vencería a las 72 hs hábiles de realizar la misma. ¡¡Desde ya ante cualquier inquietud por favor no dudes en consultarnos, saludos.
>
> Casagrande está ubicada sobre la calle Aromo N º 255, entre las calles Boyero y Becasina. A 300 mts. del mar y a 150 mts. del centro comercial en un entorno natural bellísimo donde podrá realizar distintos paseos, cabalgatas, cuatritravesias, turismo aventura y otros.
> El complejo cuenta con dos sectores y posee ascensores en ambos cuerpos.
> Nuestros servicios están ideados, para que usted y su familia se sientan a gusto y disfruten plenamente de sus vacaciones.
>
> Servicios:
>
> * Desayuno servido en la unidad (medialunas, rebanadas de pan blanco y negro, untables, yogurt, ensalada de frutas, jugo exprimido, leche, café, té).
> * Servicio de mucama con lavado de vajilla del desayuno, y ropa blanca.
> * Toallón extra para piscina uno por día por persona.
> * Servicio de masajes tercerizado, en caso de cancelación con menos de 3 hs de antelación se deberá abonar el mismo sin excepción.
> * Wi-Fi.
> * Estacionamiento según disponibilidad (No numerado).
>
>
> * Piscina in-out climatizada.
> * Sauna seco.
> * Gimnasio. (SERVICIO EXCLUSIVO PARA ADULTOS).
> * Salón de Juegos (Ping pong, metegol, pool, fichas ilimitadas sin cargo).
>
>
> Temporada alta
> * Servicio de playa (sombrilla y 3 sillas)
> * Servicio de animación.
>
>
> Recepción y áreas públicas
>
>
>
> **********************************************************************
>
> Unidad de 135 mts2.  (Unidad N°  3 - 4 )
>
>
> Primer Piso.
>
>
> departamento 3
>
>
>
> departamento 4
>
>
>
> Se compone de dos dormitorios, el principal con cama King 2 mts x 2 mts, Un baño completo con jacuzzi, vestidor con caja de seguridad digital y Smart Tv 43 ¨pulgadas. El segundo dormitorio posee 2 camas twin; de una de ellas se despliega una cama adicional de las mismas dimensiones, este dormitorio cuenta con placares y TV Led de 24´´.
> Entre los 2 dormitorios se encuentra un segundo baño de uso común completo.
> El living comedor y la cocina se encuentran en un ambiente cálido y espacioso, en el encontramos muebles de diseño y tecnología, Smart Tv 43 pulgadas, un sofá cama en el cual se pueden acondicionar 2 camas simples.
> En este gran espacio una barra delimita el living comedor de la cocina.
> La cocina posee horno, heladera con freezer, campana extractora, microondas, entre otros electrodomésticos, vajilla completa. El balcón terraza (cubierto) es un espacio único, donde ubicamos la parrilla, una mesa alta con banquetas y un living externo, donde podrá disfrutar de la naturaleza.
> Esta unidad es calefaccionada de manera central, frío-calor y en forma independiente con comando individual.
>
>
> Unidad de 135 mts2 PARA HASTA 5PAX
> Tarifa  2026
>
>
> **Tarifas del 04/01 al 11/01 (tarifa x departamento)**
> **de domingo a domingo**
>
>
> **Por 7 noches**
> **$ 4.564.000.- Total x banco transferencia o deposito.**
> **$ 3.993.500.- Total en efectivo en oficina.**
>
>
> Condiciones generales:
> *Las tarifas y servicios mencionados son PROMOCIONALES POR PAGO 100% ANTICIPADO.
> ABONANDO EN EFECTIVO EN OFICINAS DE COBRO UNICAMENTE (Bs As/Carilo) O HASTA AGOTAR UNIDADES PROMOCIONADAS.
>
> No aceptamos Mascotas.
> No trabajamos con tarjetas de crédito, ni débito.
> Check in 15:00 hs. (Horario de ingreso hasta las 22.30hs) - Check out 10:00 hs
>
>
> **********************************************************************
> **Studio Monoambiente / 40 m2   (Unidad 7 )**
>
>
> **Segundo Piso.**
> **(Acceso por escalera interna)**
>
>
> **departamento 7**
>
> Cuenta con un hogar a leños ubicado en el centro que subdivide al Studio en dos partes, el sector de descanso y el del de living-cocina.
> En el sector de descanso encontramos una cama de medidas King, un sector para el guardado de ropa, caja de seguridad digital, Smart 40”, Split frío/calor, Toilette equipado con sanitarios, ducha y secador de cabello.
> En el sector del living se encuentra un sillón, una mesa ratona y al igual
> que en los departamentos se puede adicionar 1 cama simple, una barra con 2 banquetas altas. La cocina posee anafe eléctrico, heladera con freezer, termo tanque eléctrico, microondas y vajilla completa.
> Importante: Esta unidad no cuenta con Jacuzzi, ni balcón con parrilla.
>
>
>
>
> **Studio Monoambiente / 40 m2   (Unidad 7 )**
>
>
> **Segundo Piso.**
> **(Acceso por escalera interna)**
> **Para 2 personas   **
>
>
> **Tarifas 2026**
>
>
> **Tarifas del 04/01 al 11/01**
> **de domingo a domingo**
>
>
> **Por 7 noches**
> **$ 2.407.500.- Total x banco transferencia o deposito.**
> **$ 2.106.500.- Total en efectivo en oficina.**
>
>
> Condiciones generales:
> *Las tarifas y servicios mencionados son PROMOCIONALES POR PAGO 100% ANTICIPADO.
> ABONANDO EN EFECTIVO EN OFICINAS DE COBRO UNICAMENTE (Bs As/Carilo) O HASTA AGOTAR UNIDADES PROMOCIONADAS.
> No aceptamos Mascotas.
> No trabajamos con tarjetas de crédito, ni débito.
> Check in 15:00 hs. (Horario de ingreso hasta las 22.30hs) - Check out 10:00 hs
> **************************************************************************
>
> Para realizar una reserva deberá completar los datos que figuran en la solicitud que a continuación detallamos
> Una vez recibida la solicitud, iniciaremos la reserva formal.
> Muchas gracias.
>
>
> SOLICITUD DE RESERVA
>

>
> *************************************************************************
>
> Ante cualquier inquietud no dude en consultarnos, ya que nos encontramos a su entera disposición.
> WhatsApp   : 2267-409029
>
> 02254 - 470739
> 02254 - 470673

>
>
> ¡Esperamos su confirmación!
> En dicho caso, por favor, llenar solicitud de reserva.
>
> Atte. Melisa

headlines: ["I confirm attendance at Labor Day Renaissance Weekend in Monterey", "Registration confirmation and records check for Labor Day Renaissance Weekend"]
anchors: ["confirm attendance", "lecture seminar panel assignments", "records for you and your family", "one room and common meals", "Labor Day Renaissance Weekend", "see you in Monterrey", "waive registration fees", "registration confirmation"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Renaissance Weekend
To:
  - 'gabriel.kreiman@tch.harvard.edu'
  - 'W:'
  - 'SG W:'
Time: 2025-06-24T16:44:44+00:00
Subject: FW: Labor Day Renaissance Weekend - Registration Confirmation -
 Correction
Correction, with apologies:  We look forward to welcoming you to the Labor Day Renaissance Weekend in Monterey.
Regards,
Renaissance Weekend
info@renwkd.org | www.RenaissanceWeekend.org
Post Office Box 22049, Charleston, 
SC 29413
From: Renaissance Weekend
Sent: Tuesday, June 24, 2025 12:34 PM
To: 'gabriel.kreiman@tch.harvard.edu' ; 'W:' ; 'SG W:' 
Subject: Labor Day Renaissance Weekend - Registration Confirmation
We look forward to welcoming you to the Fourth of July Renaissance Weekend in Monterey.
Attached is the information we have in our Renaissance Weekend records for you and your family/guest(s).  Please check to be sure it is accurate.  If you have any corrections or comments, kindly send them to us in the body of an e-mail to info@renwkd.org (rather than within the attached document).  Please note:  we do not need phone numbers.
Since the gathering's program consists of presentations by all participants and therefore is not organized until about one month before the Weekend, we'll be proposing your lecture, seminar, and/or panel assignments at that time.  Little, if any preparation, will be necessary, as the sessions are curated to prompt participant's customary presentations and will focus on your specific expertise.  And the sessions are all highly informal and off-the-record.
As our invitation letter noted, we would be pleased to waive Registration Fees and provide one room & Common Meals for you and your accompanying family (sons & daughters ages 21 or younger) from the first evening program through the final morning session.  Transportation would be your responsibility.
The Tentative Program and Program Assignments will be sent to you by e-mail approximately two weeks prior to the start of the Weekend.
If you have any questions, feel free to let us know.  Your participation will certainly help ensure that this will be yet another memorable Renaissance Weekend.
With thanks and regards,

Message 1
From: service@blackearthcompost.com
To: gkreiman@gmail.com
Time: 2025-04-22T17:47:06+00:00
Subject: Service Alert: Contamination
Service Alert: Contamination
|  Hello Gabriel, Your driver noted non-compostable item(s) in your bin today (plastics, glass, fabrics, waste, etc.) and may not have been able to empty your bin. Please remove all contamination before our next visit. If you believe this was a misunderstanding and the material is certified compostable please let us know.
Helpful Resources:
\- View our compost guide for a list of acceptable and non-acceptable items:
\- We accept the third-party certifications listed below. Look for their logo on the packaging. If you are unsure about a product, each company has a look-up tool on their website. The words biodegradable, compostable or ASTM-6400 alone are not enough for us to accept a product. It needs to be third-party certified to ensure it breaks down into acceptable non-toxic substrates.
  * Biodegradable Products Institute (BPI)
  * Compost Manufacturing Alliance(CMA)
  * OK Compost/TUV
Thank you,
Black Earth Compost Team
|    Black Earth Compost My Account         We use email to communicate important service information.
Please mark emails from Black Earth Compost as important to avoid going to spam.

headlines: ["Confirm Renaissance Weekend registration and assignments with no changes", "Forward Renaissance Weekend information to family members", "Receive Labor Day Renaissance Weekend confirmation and materials", "Receive acknowledgment from Renaissance Weekend of confirmation"]
anchors: ["looking forward to events", "confirmed and no changes needed", "acknowledgment", "thank you", "Renaissance weekend", "confirmation and materials", "registration materials", "looking forward to seeing you", "program assignments", "attachments included", "forwarded message", "registration confirmation", "urgent requests", "tentative program", "deadline 12pm EST on August 14th"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: "Renaissance Weekend"
To:
  - gabriel.kreiman@tch.harvard.edu
  - gkreiman@gmail.com
Time: 2025-08-13T13:04:13-04:00
Subject: Labor Renaissance Weekend / Reply by 12pm EST on THURSDAY, August
 14th
We are so pleased you’ll join us soon! Attached please find your: REGISTRATION CONFIRMATION, PROGRAM ASSIGNMENTS and the TENTATIVE PROGRAM. To meet our printer’s deadline, please respond immediately:
1)	 REPLY to confirm receipt of these materials: 'Got it! No changes requested,' or, if necessary, 'These are my urgent requests . . .'
2)	 FORWARD these materials to all members of your party.  
3) 	Carefully read all attachments and review your PROGRAM ASSIGNMENTS:
*  Especially CHECK THE TIMES of your assigned roles to be sure they don't conflict with your arrival or departure times. 
*  Kindly limit any requests for changes to factual errors or extremely strong preferences not to participate as requested. We regret that only requests received by the deadline (12pm EST on August 14th) can be considered for the final program.
4) 	Inform us of any ERRORS in your attached registration or nametag info. If the professional title of anyone in your party is truly INCORRECT (see PAGE 3 of your Program Assignments PDF), we’ll try to adjust it within space constraints.
5)	 As you review these materials, we encourage you to take a deep breath and relax. Our gatherings are informal and conversational opportunities to learn from and LISTEN to each other. All participants are far more accomplished than the program’s limited bio references can convey, and we apologize for inevitable omissions of noteworthy items. 
6)	 To attend ANY session, you need not be “assigned” to it. Few sessions require any significant preparation; and all seek to be only “conversation-starters” to prompt the informal chats central to the Weekend’s enjoyment. 
7)	 Confirm and raise any questions about accommodations directly with your hotel. Read the previously sent and attached Guide to R/W re: attire.
8) 			Be sure to make meal reservations for the ON-YOUR-OWN Dinner (Saturday, August 30th) and Lunch (Sunday, August 31st).
9) On-site REGISTRATION begins THURSDAY, August 28th, at 4 pm, in the Cypress Foyer at the Monterey Plaza Hotel. There you’ll receive the Final Program and Assignments – which may differ considerably from the attached materials. The List of Participants will be included in your printed program; we do not send it or the Final Program electronically. Thank you for understanding.
10) Afternoons are left unscheduled: Friday from 3:00 P.M. to 6:00 P.M.; Saturday from 3:00 P.M. through the evening, including dinner on your own, and Sunday from 1:00 P.M. to 6:00 P.M., including lunch on your own,  for participants' personal recreation. 
First-time participants are invited to R/W 101, an elective pre-registration briefing by long-time participants to help optimize your Renaissance experience. Also, at the Welcome Reception and throughout the Weekend, past participants – wearing white nametags, with newcomers sporting blue ones – will be pleased to answer questions and convey this gathering’s traditions.
Login and check out www.RenaissanceWeekend.org/upcoming-weekends for other information. Please read the attached Guide to R/W thoroughly, which will explain the program formats, time constraints, roles & other matters and should address your questions. As the Weekend approaches, we will not be able to reply to all inquiries. Again, please read the Guide to R/W thoroughly. However, kindly notify us ASAP if your arrival date is delayed. 
We appreciate your upholding the hallmarks of Renaissance:  
* respect for the opinions of others
* cordiality
* non-partisanship
* confidentiality
* informality
* flexibility
* civility
* taking relationships and issues—but not ourselves—seriously. 
We look forward to seeing you in Monterey!
Ali & Joy
Renaissance Weekend
info@renwkd.org | www.RenaissanceWeekend.org
Post Office Box 22049, Charleston, 
SC 29413

Content-Transfer-Encoding:	base64
Content-Disposition:	attachment; filename="Guide_to_Renaissance.pdf"

full_content:
Message 1
From: Nancy Poole
To: Gabriel Kreiman
Time: 2025-07-01T10:55:57-04:00
Subject: Camera Culture group?
Hi Gabriel,
My resume is being submitted to the Cameral Culture group at MIT for a part
time admin position. Do you know anything about it, or anyone affiliated
with it? As you know, I want a part time admin position, so this seems to
be a very good fit. I've had a few false starts, but the woman at the
placement agency was really excited about my resume.
Also, I saw on LinkedIn that you are now the CEO of a start up!
Congratulations! I'm so pleased for you. You'll have to find time to tell
me about it the next time we have occasion to see each other.
If you have any info for the immediate issue, I'd love to hear it.
best,
NP
Message 2
From:
-- Gabriel Kreiman
To: Nancy Poole
Time: 2025-07-01T17:52:23-04:00
Subject: Re: Camera Culture group?
Hello Nancy,
I am sorry, but I do not know the Camera Culture group. I just looked it
up, and I do not know any of the people in that group. I feel bad that I am
pretty useless.
We are flying tomorrow, but yes, we will catch up when we are back.
Best,
Gabriel

headlines: ["DPU approves National Grid proposal to defer residential gas delivery charges"]
anchors: ["energy efficiency surcharge", "defer 10% of residential gas delivery charges", "Distribution Adjustment line", "evenly re-applied from May through October", "interest charges waived"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: "National Grid"
To: gkreiman@gmail.com
Time: 2025-03-14T15:01:38-06:00
Subject: Important bill update
Our commitment to customers
|  |  |
| We have been working collaboratively with the Massachusetts Department of Public Utilities (DPU) and other utilities in Massachusetts to find ways to help reduce this winter's energy bill impact.
**Our recent proposal to defer 10% of residential gas delivery charges was approved by the DPU.** The deferred charges will appear in the Distribution Adjustment line on your March and April bills. These charges will then be evenly re-applied to your bills monthly from May through October. All interest charges for this deferral have been waived.
Additionally, National Grid and the other Sponsors of Mass Save® have lowered the proposed costs within the three-year energy efficiency plan to help reduce the energy efficiency surcharge on your bill. We’ll keep you updated on any rate adjustments as they are determined.
We are committed to delivering safe and reliable natural gas to you and the communities we serve. We recognize that affordability is a significant concern, and we'll continue working with regulators, elected officials, and others on efforts to provide longer-term rate relief.
We offer various programs and services to help you manage your energy bill, access financial assistance or request a payment plan if needed.
[Find Bill Assistance]
|  |  [ National Grid ]
 |  |   |   |   |   |  
---|---|---|---|---
|  |  This email was sent to gkreiman@gmail.com
Please do not reply to this email
as this email address is not monitored.
170 Data Drive, Waltham, MA 02451

headlines: ["Fernando requests donations for 2025 Pan Mass Challenge ride"]
anchors: ["donation via credit card or venmo", "personal minimum goal is to collect $6,000", "160 miles Bike Ride", "Pan Mass Challenge", "Jimmy Fund"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Fernando Dangond
To: Bolts Gans, Josh Lori
Time: 2025-07-06T11:49:27-04:00
Subject: PMC ride 2025 - asking for your support (Fernando Dangond)
Dear friends,
Hope all is well with you and your families.
On August 2 and 3, 2025, I’ll be doing again the Pan Mass Challenge (PMC),
a more than 160 miles Bike Ride to collect funds for cancer, more
specifically for the Jimmy Fund (Dana Farber Cancer Institute) where my
daughter Christina Dangond was treated for 5 years, until she passed away
to be with the Lord, on January 26, 2018. This is the 13th consecutive year
that I participate as a cyclist and fundraiser for this noble cause.
The Jimmy Fund really does an extraordinary job and it is important that
this noble mission continues to be achieved every year to alleviate the
suffering of children afflicted with this terrible disease. A hundred per
cent of the funds collected at the PMC bike ride go directly to support the
Jimmy Fund.
I am writing to ask you to consider a donation (there is no minimal amount
per donor; any amount is of course welcome) but my personal minimum goal is
to collect $6,000 prior to August 2.
The instructions to make a donation via the internet, are outlined below:
The link is:
http://profile.pmc.org/FD0029
Note that my name is just the identifier as these funds never come to me
directly but to PMC.
Follow the instructions to donate via credit card or venmo.
Thank you so much for your support of this noble cause!
Fernando Dangond

Information         
Hello Gabriel,
Thanks for booking with Go Buses.
**Please note that if you have a gmail account and have not received your ticket confirmation e-mail it could be stuck in your spam or junk folders. Please add confirmations@gobuses.com ( https://academybus-news.com/c/AQjB8AsQotmAARjMqtrLASCNk7YfYhy0L2u8THrTyy9_0IEQh-PX4cltwffLXnuxk9M8R-8 ) to your contact list to prevent blocked emails.**

We recommend arriving at the stop 15-30 minutes prior to departure.Seats on Go Buses are not assigned but offered on a first come first served basis.All customers who require a seat must purchase a ticket.Only registered service animals are permitted to ride on Go Buses.If you need to change your ticket login to your account and select the amend function.Click here ( https://academybus-news.com/c/AQjB8AsQotmAARjMqtrLASCD45csMLRtTxNKjmpwAeo-fGYlYAfo1-3v2sOWJ7hXYTKLVgo ) to learn more about our rewards program. full_content:
Message 1
From: "OurNewton.org"
To: gkreiman@gmail.com
Time: 2025-11-05T14:04:16+00:00
Subject: Home Is Where the Heart Is: November in Newton 🧡
https://ournewton.org/
In Newton, home is where the heart is—and November reminds us how much we have to give. This week’s roundup is filled with ways to connect, contribute, and celebrate—from craft fairs to cozy pie socials to jazz that stirs the soul. Whether you're giving thanks, giving back, or simply gathering with neighbors, you'll find heartfelt opportunities below. Visit OurNewton.org (https://ournewton.org/) often to stay close to what makes our community feel like home.
https://ournewton.org/%f0%9f%a5%a7a-slice-of-kindness-pies-portraits-for-a-cause/
** 🥧A Slice of Kindness
Pies, portraits, and purpose
For 20 years, I've helped Newton families find home. For 8 of those years, I've loved hosting a pie event to give back to our community. Join me for holiday portraits by Cheryl Clegg, homemade pies from Ward's Berry Farm, and an afternoon of connection—all supporting the Newton Food Pantry.
Hosted by Janet Porcaro, Newton Realtor® & Community Connector
Order your pie by Nov 16 (https://ournewton.org/%f0%9f%a5%a7a-slice-of-kindness-pies-portraits-for-a-cause/)
** Holiday Craft Fair
The Woman’s Club of Newton Highlands presents its 21st annual craft fair this Thursday. Get ahead on your holiday shopping with beautiful handmade gifts. Womens Club of Newton Highlands
Discover the fun (https://ournewton.org/event/womans-club-21st-annual-craft-fair/)
https://ournewton.org/event/womans-club-21st-annual-craft-fair/
https://ournewton.org/event/scarecrow-stroll/2025-11-08/
** Scarecrow Stroll
Join us for a FREE, family friendly scarecrow adventure at Nahanton Park.  Stroll through the scarecrows and complete a scavenger hunt along the way.  Vote for your favorite to help us crown the fan favorite.
November 8 and 9 from 11 am to 3 pm
Be a part of it! (https://ournewton.org/event/scarecrow-stroll/2025-11-08/)
** Newton Free Library 150th Anniversary Celebration
This November is the 150th anniversary of the vote to transfer the Library to the City of Newton, so we’re throwing an anniversary party on November 8! Throughout the day, there will be activities for adults and kids of all ages.
Mark your calendar (https://ournewton.org/event/newton-free-library-150th-anniversary-celebration/)
https://ournewton.org/event/newton-free-library-150th-anniversary-celebration/
https://ournewton.org/read-your-worlds-free-diverse-childrens-and-ya-book-sign-up/
** Read Your World
This is the 14th year of giving away free diverse KidLit. Simply write a short review and post it to Amazon, Goodreads, or social media in exchange for books.
Get a free book in exchange for your review!
Be a part of it! (https://readyourworld.org/bookmatchprogram/)
** Fair Housing Listening Session
One of the critical components of the Massachusetts Affordable Homes Act is the establishment of the state’s first Office of Fair Housing and the Fair Housing Trust Fund to expand efforts to provide access to housing.  This includes working to overcome patterns of segregation in housing and to support better access to housing and affordability. November 6
Dive deeper (https://ournewton.org/event/fair-housing-listening-session-with-state-secretary-augustus/)
https://ournewton.org/event/fair-housing-listening-session-with-state-secretary-augustus/
https://ournewton.org/event/fall-business-breakfast-4/
** Fall Business Breakfast
The Charles River Regional Chamber’s signature annual gathering, presented by Needham Bank, brings together hundreds of civic and business leaders for a morning of connection, inspiration, and celebration. November 7
Save your seat (https://crrc.charlesriverchamber.com/ap/Events/Register/XqFxv2vh7CDCz)
** All Newton Music School
Enjoy a recital by cello faculty, Kelly Knox, along with Leonardo Vásquez, viola, and April Sun, piano. November 8
Learn more (https://ournewton.org/event/kelly-knox-cello-faculty-recital/)
https://ournewton.org/event/kelly-knox-cello-faculty-recital/
https://ournewton.org/event/there-was-there-was-not/
** There Was, There Was Not
In this documentary, myth and reality intertwine to reveal the lives of four Armenian women facing the loss of their homeland. Following the screening, filmmaker Emily Mkrtichian will join a Q&A discussion moderated by Paul Boghosian, President of Harbor Side Films, producer of documentaries (PBS), public affairs programming as well as major television and cable and streaming projects. November 7 from 7 to 9 pm
View event details (https://ournewton.org/event/there-was-there-was-not/)
This newsletter is powered by you—share your local happenings at OurNewton.org (https://ournewton.org/share/) and help fuel the spirit of connection.
https://lifeinnewton.com/
Contact Janet 
https://instagram.com/ournewton
https://facebook.com/ournewton
https://linkedin.com/janetporcaro
https://youtube.com/janetsville
Copyright (C) 2025 Ournewton.org. All rights reserved.
You are receiving this email because you opted in for the OurNewton.org newsletter.
My mailing address is:
Ournewton.org
1340 Centre Street
Suite 202
Newton, Ma 02459
USA
Want to change how you receive these emails?

headlines: ["Campaign email requesting support for Newton City Council run"]
anchors: ["running for Newton City Council", "support my campaign", "hosting a lawn sign", "donate to my campaign"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: John Chaimanis
To: GABRIEL
Time: 2025-09-22T12:06:13+00:00
Subject: I’m Running for Newton City Council to Strengthen Our Schools, Finances, Small Businesses, and Villages
Endorsed by: Marc Laredo, Lenny Gentile, John Oliver, Tarik
Lucas, Pam Wright, Julia Malakie, Randy Block, Rena Getz, Alan
Lobovits, Stephen Farrell, Paul Levy, Chris Markiewicz, Paul
Coletti
Dear Neighbor,
I’m running for Newton City Council At-Large citywide, and I’m
looking for your support. As a father of three young children in
the NPS, a business owner, and an active community volunteer, I
care deeply about our city’s future. I believe that Newton can
continue to thrive by focusing on strengthening our schools,
managing city finances responsibly, supporting small businesses
and ensuring that local voices are heard when changes are
proposed.
My experience as an entrepreneur, the founder of a school and
father of young children, as well as my expertise in finance and
sustainability positively differentiate me in this contested
race. I represent the voices of a broad and diverse group of
supporters who believe that I can add important depth to our City
Council and a voice for common sense.
I want to hear your feedback - please email me letting me know
what matters most to you.
If you’ve read my story, and believe that I have what it takes to
execute on our vision for Newton, then please support my campaign
by telling your friends, hosting a lawn sign, or emailing me with
your ideas.

A BIT MORE ABOUT ME
I have dedicated my career to using finance to create a positive
impact. Today, I run a clean energy investment firm that employs
a dozen people directly and scores more through our work. We have
invested over $500M in clean energy projects, and have produced
enough clean energy to power 25,000 homes. Prior to my work in
sustainability, and immediately after graduating with a finance
degree from Villanova, I served as a full time volunteer teacher
at Nativity Prep in Boston, and subsequently I co-founded an
inner-city school in Dorchester, where I ran the business and
operations.
I am a hard worker and strong believer in giving back. I’m active
in Newton as a youth sports coach, as a community organizer and
as a volunteer in my church, the Sacred Heart Our Lady’s
Collaborative.
I live in Auburndale, where my 3 young kids attend the NPS (Burr
and Day), and it would be an honor to serve you as Councilor at
Large.
Your vote and my common sense approach will ensure a strong
Newton today and tomorrow.
